items.name: A modified offline version of starsearcher or "Persean Commercial Realty Group"
items.summary:
Based on https://gomtuu.org/starsearcher/ 
Things I have added:
items.description:
Based on https://gomtuu.org/starsearcher/ 
Things I have added:
1. Search for planets based on certain conditions (resources etc)
2. Search for planets based on distance to core world
3. Show a flag to indicated if a planet has a gate or domain comm array in the system
4. Increase the search timeout to 120 seconds
5. Fixed a bug that causes all planets' ruin conditions show as "Scattered Ruins" 
6. Display Techmining Multplier; if the text is bold, the ruin has not been explored - June 13, 2023
7. Add some exception handling when reading the save file, probably better compatibility with mods. If you have some issue with your save, send it to me and I would take a look. - June 20, 2023
8. Added a filter for planet type - September 15, 2023
9. I have published the project on cloudflare. https://starsearcher-modded-by-sycspy.pages.dev/index-1.htm - September 20, 2023
10. More bug fixings - November 23, 2023
11. Merged the changes from innkalling for smarter resource search, now it matches by the lowest selected resource abundance - November 28, 2023

## Description
Configure and create more stable locations in Starsector.

items.name: Advanced Gunnery Control
items.summary: **Now with refit-screen integration! (Should now work with JRE8)**
items.description:
**Now with refit-screen integration! (Should now work with JRE8)**

*Requires 0.96a-RC10+*

**A utility mod allowing you to customize weapon behavior on autofire, such as e.g. targeting/avoiding shields.**

Install and press J in combat, in refit, or on the world map to open a GUI.

Features:     
- Many tags, such as targeting or avoiding shields, PD mode and many many more
- GUI-based configuration in combat/refit or on the campaign map
- Tags are automatically saved between combats and reloads
- Seamlessly switch between simple mode (6 tags) and advanced mode (over 20 tags)
- Customize AI-controlled ship behavior through ship modes
- Create your own default tags with the option to automatically apply them
- Customize most aspects of the mod through an extensive settings file
- Manually control multiple weapon groups at once using the Merge tag

```
Can be updated/added/removed to/from ongoing campaigns.
```

To mod-authors:
If you want to integrate with AGC to improve ship/weapon AI behavior of your faction, check the readme. Feel free to ping me if you need help or want to request a special mode.

items.description:
**Starsector Update Edition!**
A new faction (and another surprise one) with many new generally available ship hulls: Kestrel-class Frigate, Perch-class Heavy Carrier, Roost-class Carrier, Lifter Cargo Courier, and the large modular battlecruiser sized Rigger Salvager. A collection of mods which adds/buffs/modifies the Derelict Drones found out in the wild of Starsector. These mods should be 100% compatible with all other mods excluding major overhauls that aren't normally compatible with any other mods.

**Changelog:**
New Drones+
Vanilla+

I only updated the version. As I have heard it still works. I will be playing with it soon.
I will also test the submods. Hopefully will update those in the coming weeks.


**Mods available:**
**All the Domain Drones+ Vanilla**
Recommended new save. I cannot guarantee this mod will work on an existing save.
This mod modifies Vanilla drones, increasing their stats. It also upgrades the Domain Faction and allows Motherships and Survey Ships to spawn Derelict fleets as if they were [REDACTED] Battlestations. Download Link:  https://www.dropbox.com/s/lxqxz8w8j4zemrx/Domain%20Drones%2B%20Vanilla.rar?dl=1

Should work on existing saves, do tell me if it doesn't.
This mod adds new Domain Drones. Capital ships, Cruisers, Destroyers, fuel ships, cargo ships, frigates, wings, mining ships, carriers and a new buildable Derelict Station (with three Tiers) to colonies. Also adds proper survey ships and probes to those explorable. Overhauls the Mothership into a more threatening station. Derelict stations can also appear as Pirate stations, these send Derelict raids (you can also buy ships from them, don't ask why). items.name: Automated Commands
items.summary:
This mod adds new hullmods that allow the player to set predefined battle commands for AI-piloted ships in their fleet.
e.g. The Auto retreat command hullmod will force the ship to retreat when below a certain hull integrity level.
items.description:
This mod adds new hullmods that allow the player to set predefined battle commands for AI-piloted ships in their fleet.
e.g. The Auto retreat command hullmod will force the ship to retreat when below a certain hull integrity level.

__Current Features__
**Retreat** when the ship is below a certain **hull integrity** level. (90% or 60% or 30%)
**Retreat** when the ship has exceeded its **peak performance** time.
**Retreat** when the ship is below a certain **CR level**. (60% or 40% or 0%)
**Retreat** when the ship has **no missile left**. (the hullmod can only be added to ships with least one missile weapon equipped)
Forced **vent** when ship's flux is at 80% (or higher)
Carriers will automatically toggle between **engage and regroup** when their replacement is at 20% or 80%

Override the **personality** for non-officered ships (works for flagship on auto)



__Installation__

Just download the mod and unpack the ZIP file into your mods folder.
Download: https://github.com/borgrel/AutomatedCommands/releases/download/v1.4/AutomatedCommands.v1.4.zip
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21576.0

items.name: Crew Replacer
items.summary:
crew replacer V0.6.4.1
a modders utility. this modders whatsit acts as a utility allowing modders to make mutable things (mostly commodities) do 'jobs'. it also allows modders to make it so other modders can add different things to be used in a custom job they have created.
items.description:
crew replacer V0.6.4.1
a modders utility. this modders whatsit acts as a utility allowing modders to make mutable things (mostly commodities) do 'jobs'. it also allows modders to make it so other modders can add different things to be used in a custom job they have created.
examples:
in the base game, you can 'salvage'. to 'salvage' you require 2 commodities 'crew' and 'heavy machinery'.  crew replacer replaces the 2 commodities with 2 'crewReplacer_Job's called 'salvage_crew' and 'salvage_heavyMachinery'. the two jobs then act as a storage for different 'crewReplacer_Crew's. from there, a modder can access and add there own 'crewReplacer_Crew' to any of the jobs,  and thus adding a commodity (or other thing) to the list of things that can be used in salvaging.

please note: this mod does nothing on its own. the game will stay exsactly the same as before. it just enables modders to change some thing easier

also this project has not coverd all the possible vanila jobs yet. im working on it dont worry 🙂
changelog: https://github.com/Alaricdragon/Crew_Replacer/blob/master/jars/src/desing/changelog
```
V0.6.4.1:
    save compatible with v0.6.2+

        refactored the name of one, and only one, file in the inter code.

items.name: Customizable Star Systems
items.summary: Create your own custom star systems via a JSON file in this mod's config folder! Includes a default custom star system, with superb candidates for colonization.
items.description:
Create your own custom star systems via a JSON file in this mod's config folder! Includes a default custom star system, with superb candidates for colonization.

*v1.0.2 Patch Notes*
```
* "marketSize" option now supports numbers greater than 10 if bigger population conditions exists due to other mods
  - If no such conditions exist (or their IDs do not match the "population_##" string), "marketSize" will continue to cap population size at 10, as before.

* Added "systemLightColor" option for custom star systems

* Added "orbitRadius" support for "accretion_disk" entities
  - Also scaled the default, randomly-generated orbit radius to fix it being smaller than typical proc-gen accretion disks

* Custom star systems with a center black hole no longer auto-generate an accretion disk entity

* Added "orbitDays" support for "ring" and "asteroid_belt" entities

* Fixed an outdated error message

* "ListCustomStarSystems" and "SpawnCustomStarSystems" commands now print the exception message when syntax errors in customStarSystems.json are found
```
*v1.0.3 Patch Notes*
```
* Fixed a bug where custom star systems with comm relays or similar entities were erroneously marked as though they contained a Coronal Hypershunt
  - This also fixes "isCoreWorldSystem" tags being overridden due to this same bug

* Fixed logging for generating custom star systems during new game creation

* "SpawnCustomStarSystems" command and the related LunaSnippet now print the exception messages for generation and syntax errors, respectively

* Minor code refactors
```

items.name: Demto's Ship Pack (v 1.1.2)
items.summary:
From the maker of Demto's Ship Pack for Starsector version 0.95, now introducing...
Demto's Ship Pack for Starsector 0.96!
items.description:
From the maker of Demto's Ship Pack for Starsector version 0.95, now introducing...
Demto's Ship Pack for Starsector 0.96!

A small ship pack featuring a bunch of ships, ~~weapons~~ and fighters, hand-crafted and field tested (occasionally). Put them in your starting fleet, or find them at your local vanilla faction. 

Full changelog in mod file

Version 1.1.2: Balance changes and some fixes.
```
Ships:
- Removed the Turmoil from the Hightech blueprint package. Phaseships are apparently just rare_bp by default.
- Decreased the Turmoil's system charge regen from 0.15 to 0.12. With sysex it was just a bit too easy to move all over the place. Still is, but what can you do.
- Changed the Supervisor's speed to 70 from 80, flux capacity to 5500 from 5800, and the shield arc to 240 from 270. An attempt to balance the ship out a bit more, since in my experience it remains as much of a hassle to fight as the monitor. Its lower speed means its easier to catch out and also means it cant really disengage or chase as well, while the decreased shield arc renders it vulnerable to flanks.
- Removed another 'Overseer' mention from the Supervisor desc. I can't read.
- Decreased the Morpho's speed by 10, to bring it more in line with other destroyers.
Fighters:
- Fixed some weapon tag issues. Wrong column, oops.
- Increased the Stormsprite's weapon EMP to 70 from 50 and magazine size to 20 from 15. Now that the weapon tags work, missiles will be targeted as well, and this is intended as a compensatory measure while also making it a bit better at its job. LMK if it ends up being too good.
- Increased the Angst's armor to 100 from 75, decreased speed to 165 from 200 and cut the system cooldown by 1 second. Still trying to figure out how to make this little guy work.
```
Download: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ip_qon-RdUVaaNnlMwmMIhnyhmjcJqvH/view?usp=sharing
Discord-only for now. Ping me for questions/balance concerns/bugs/broken links and the like.

items.summary:
Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
` `
items.description:
Unparalleled ship customization at your fingertips. Customize shields & engines, change systems, alter slot types / sizes with these new hull modifications and slot shunts!
` `
**FOREWARNING**
The 'Experimental' in the title is not just for novelty. Please use "Save Copy" before using this mod; in other words, back your save up.
The goal of this mod is providing extreme customization; balance isn't on any priority list. Extreme cases will be adjusted but that's pretty much it.

**Hull Modifications:** Will become available immediately
• Experimental Hull Modifications: Provides a base to all other hull modifications in this mod
• Over-Engineered: Provides 20% OP bonus and some slot-points to the ship when built-in
• Logistics Overhaul: Strips the ship of all combat capabilities in favour of logistics
• Auxiliary Generators: Provides some slot-points in exchange for ordnance points
• AI Switch: Turns automated ships into normal, or normal ships into automated ones

**Hull Modification Categories:** Will become available immediately
• Systems: Most vanilla systems are turned into hull modifications
• Retrofits: Alters the weapon slots of a ship all together
• Cosmetics: Fully customizable hull modifications to change shield and engine colours. Customization is done through the mod settings menu
• Activators: Uses slot shunts to provide the ship with various enhancements by altering the slot they're installed on

**Slot Shunt Categories:** May be obtained after activating the new ability. These, along with their activators alter the ship in different ways
• Adapters: Turns a bigger slot into smaller versions (3 large, 1 medium types)
• Converters: Turns a smaller slot into a bigger one by using slot points (1 medium, 1 small types)
• Diverters: Turns a slot inactive and yield slot points to be used by above (1 small type)
• Capacitors: Enhances the total flux capacity of the ship (1 small type)
• Dissipators: Enhances the total flux dissipation of the ship (1 small type)
• Launch Tubes: Turns a large slot into a fighter hangar (1 large type)

```diff
+ Save compatible; safe to install/update
- Cannot be removed; back your save up
```

items.name: Exotica Technologies
items.summary:
Upgrade your ships using resources, credits and salvaged technology. Fight stronger enemy fleets!
` `
items.description:
Upgrade your ships using resources, credits and salvaged technology. Fight stronger enemy fleets!
` `
Exotica Technologies offers an RPG element to Starsector that makes your ships AND enemies harder, better, faster, stronger through upgrades and exotics! These upgrades do not take OP or hullmod slots! Each ship has a limit to the number of upgrades they can install so choose wisely! The cost of each upgrade will require common materials salvaged across the sector such as metal and transplutonics. However, as upgrades get more complex and specialized, they tend to consume more resources and even demand special items found through research stations and mining stations!

Changelog in latest post. **1.6.0 makes the game harder.**
This mod requires MagicLib, LazyLib, LunaLib, and **the latest version of Combat Activators**.

Save compatible with all previous versions of Exotica and can be added mid-save with no loss of functionality, even for salvage exploration. This mod does not affect drops of other exploration items, namely colony items, and are rolled completely separately.

items.name: Furry Portrait Pack 1.16
items.summary: A pack of around 100 portraits provided by the community.
items.description:
A pack of around 100 portraits provided by the community. 

```Changelog:
- added more portraits (this is the same for basically every version)```

If you want your own art in here:
- DM me (if you're in this server you do not need to send me a friend request- I will probably reject it)
- send me a 128x128 png. Images must be color and should include the head and shoulders on a black background. See the portraits in the pack for examples.
- Images should meet some minimum standards of quality, and should be drawn/painted, not pixel art. See the portraits in the pack for examples. I'm not saying you need to go out and spend $600 on an oil painting of your fursona, but it should be at least decent.
- Also send me something to indicate that you actually own/commissioned/drew whatever you just sent me. Using stuff that isn't yours will mean I just block you. Credit will remain anonymous unless you specifically ask for it in there.
- I don't care if the original image is SFW or NSFW as long as it's not obvious that it's cropped from something explicit. (ie, a crop of a nude ref sheet is fine; a crop of an o-face is not.)
- Tell me what faction(s) you want your portrait to be in. I'm not going to add your art to a modded faction unless the author's given permission for me to add portraits (apex design, exalted, keruvim).
- Tell me whether you want masculine or feminine pronouns. This will determine what pronouns the game uses in dialogue for players and NPCs with your portrait. (Starsector does not support gender-neutral pronouns for NPCs, for now)
- Assuming you did all that correctly, I'll add it in next time I feel like updating the pack. I can usually provide you with a version you can use quickly, but I only push out public updates when I have a few portraits to add.

direct download: https://github.com/theDragn/FurryPortraitPack/releases/download/1.16/Furry.Portrait.Pack_v1.16.zip

items.summary: **RC3 changes**:
items.description:
**RC3 changes**:

-CGS now officially classified as ballistic weapon that does energy damage. Don't know how I missed this for so long. Didn't break my save cause I actually implemented this change under the hood mid-campaign but YMMV; just giving you a heads-up.
-CGS fire-rate doubled from 0.05 to 0.1 - I originally just copy-pasted the vanilla vulcan fire rate when making this in the first place cause I wasn't sure if it'd even work. 
-Super Saker, Saker shield efficiency retuned. Logistics costs bumped up slightly. Yes, I nerfed them but playing a meme run where my fleet is just carriers with saker LPCs and saker strikecraft? They're doing just fine.
-Super Saker now has AAF lmao - the CGS reclassification meant high energy focus doesn't do anything anymore. Also pairs nicely with the CGS cause it allows you to have the old fire-rate for burst damage periods. :D
-I've added custom nex starts under the free start/own faction options! Now includes vanilla carrier variants bundled with Saker LPCs.
-Shield values adjusted once more because I have a smoothbrain and thought that the closer to 1.0 the better. Whoops.
-LPC Sakers got a buff. They get a dinky little shield that won't last long at all but at least it lets them last long enough to fire off a missile or two before going poof.

Gradually i added bunch of stuff like hullmods, fringe system, some wip industry, and line-up of weapons and missile that i think "missing" from the base game, and so on.

As it originally meant for personal playthrough mod, balance is number two, but it will gradually improved as i fix many things inside here and there, with primary focus of implementing the things i want and balance it later, still mostly wip mod, but serviceable? (hopefully), do tell me if something break as i mostly still play in 9.5 which is  ;).

-An hullmod that turn your manned ship min crew to 0 in exchange of being dependent of ship with control hullmod (beware it disabled ur ship if its command ship die!)
-An ship that spawn an deployable defense frigates/stationary
-Bunch of indies-esque scav ship ranging from small frigates to capital ship
-An Frontier System, inhabited with pirates and indies, serve as base of exploration in four edges of sector

-An Colony Structure that turn your colony hidden (Ie: cant be raided or attacked | also WIP)

     - Their main planet is Asteria in the Arcadia star system
- "What do I do with Artifact Electronics?"
     - You can trade them in at Asteria for Prototype ships and weapons after completing the first quest, or just sell them for cash.

items.name: MOSS (Mod Organizer for StarSector) 0.7.2
items.summary: The Mod Manager for all platforms, Rust enthusiasts, and people who hate their own eyeballs. ` `
items.description:
The Mod Manager for all platforms, Rust enthusiasts, and people who hate their own eyeballs. ` `

*Formerly known as Starsector Mod Manager*

## What's Changed
- Add Azul Zulu to JRE swapper
  - This is part of a **research** effort requested by Alex himself, investigating the _possibility_ of making Java 8 the default for Starsector in the future.
  - Please see this discord post for more details: https://discord.com/channels/187635036525166592/451195604459192341/1091014766031540346
- Fix versions being wrong in mods list for mods that do not support Version Checker
- Some internal work to improve performance (unlikely to be noticeable)

**Highlights from the previous release:**
- _Two_ separate mod browsers
  - A web browser based one, and a custom one that sources from Wisp's Unofficial Mod Repo
- A JRE swapper/upgrade utility! Switch to JRE 8 automatically and without hassle
- Mod deletion! Accessed by right-clicking on any mod entry in the main view
- Column editing
- **Near full cross-platform compatibility! This includes: vmparams editing, JRE swapping, game version detection, game launching, etc**

**Known Issues:**
- Static Linux builds are dead and gone (they never worked lmao)
- On Linux, web-browser functionality requires webkit2gtk-4.1
    - Apologies for this. I can tell you that if you don't have this already it may be a pain in the ass to get installed. Alternatives are being explored.
- Linux binaries are only tested on Ubuntu20.02, and may not work on other distros
- On macOS, sub-windows may not render/appear forced into the background when using multiple monitors
  - Sub windows can be 'surfaced' by using Mission Control to see all application windows, and dragging the subwindow to your other monitor

**Downloading:**
As this seems to be a pretty common issue, here's two notes on downloading the app:

1. You **do not want** the source code from the main repository page. That means **do not** click the `<> Code` dropdown at all
2. The same goes for the release page. Open the `Assets` accordion/dropdown. But again, **do not** click on either of the archives/zips labelled `source`. You want one the files starting with `starsector_mod_manager` or `macos.zip` - the people that need the latter should know who they are...

**Website:** <https://atlanticaccent.github.io/starsector-mod-manager-rust/>
**Download**: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/starsector-mod-manager-rust/releases/tag/0.7.2>
**Sources**: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/starsector-mod-manager-rust>

The goal of MagicLib is to create a community-built library of useful (and well documented) scripts and plugins that can be leveraged and contributed to by every modder.

**MagicBounty**
- Bounty fleets are no longer aggressive toward non-player fleets. They should no longer attack each other (reported by Avanitia).
- Days elapsed calculation was incorrect; the day of the month was used rather than days since game start during the first cycle. ** Bounties that show up after 32+ days will now actually show up before the second year.**

items.name: More Combat Terrain Effects
items.summary: Adds custom combat effects to all terrain that did not have an effect previously, and spruces up the rest.
items.description:
Adds custom combat effects to all terrain that did not have an effect previously, and spruces up the rest.

Examples:

```
Hyperstorm: Lightning from nebulae periodically strike ships after a delay and telegraph (AI reacts, somehow) for massive EMP
Pulsar: Hardflux generation, shield eff. reduction, periodic random EMP, constant pushing force from the pulsar (missiles get blown away), and all projectiles have flat EMP damage applied (Fear the lowly talon, 500x as powerful as a claw ion fighter)
Slipstream: Forces safety overrides on all fighters, missiles, and ships
Black hole: Massive pulling force to the black hole (missiles REALLY get blown away, fighters really struggle), and massive time dilation applied to all ships/fighters (permanent bullettime)

And more! 
```

REQUIRES LAZYLIB, LUNALIB

99% of all variables can be controlled via the config!

Save to add and remove from saves.

Forum thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=25567
Download: https://github.com/nikothedude/MoreCombatTerrainEffects/archive/refs/heads/release.zip

items.name: Pirate Mini Mod
items.summary:
I always feel that once you hit a certain point you are no longer really surprised by pirates.
Their roster is limited and their few ships are either weak or just repaints of existing hulls. This alongside mod power creep often renders the faction a minor annoyance or time sink even in the mid game.
items.description:
I always feel that once you hit a certain point you are no longer really surprised by pirates.
Their roster is limited and their few ships are either weak or just repaints of existing hulls. This alongside mod power creep often renders the faction a minor annoyance or time sink even in the mid game.

This is a mod meant to make pirates more unique, unhinged, and ambitious. As of now changes are simple but I plan to evolve the mod over time as I learn or get help.

Price of Command 0.0.4
items.summary: Allows your officers to get tired, get injured, and, in the worst case, **die**. ` `
items.description:
Allows your officers to get tired, get injured, and, in the worst case, **die**. ` `

To compensate for the increased demands this puts on your officers, officers are now cheaper to hire, pay, and are more numerous. Additionally, you can now have a greater number on your roster.
Mod authors may be interested in implementing their own "conditions" like fatigue and injuries. A number of methods are available for other mod authors to hook into.
```
Requires:
LazyLib, MagicLib, LunaLib
Optional:
Console Commands - Lets you inflict and heal the conditions currently in the mod, as well as just kill an officer (but why?)
```
***Not balanced AT ALL***

**Changelog:**
```
0.0.4
Features:
- After Action Reports:
  - Whenever you conclude a battle, you may be presented with a report on the condition of your officers.
  - From here, you may choose to _revise history_, applying story points in order to avert your officers' more disastrous outcomes.
- Significantly improved pre-battle officer reassignment interface 
  - Now uses almost 100& vanilla menus. Should overall be more familiar and informative.

Library features:
- Hopefully made precondition and mutation overrides nicer to use
- Added explicit listeners for: Pre-Death, Post-Death, Post-Battle, Pre-Apply Condition, Post-Apply Condition

Bug fixes:
- Too many to remember them all

Known bugs:
- Unconfirmed, but there may be interactions between this mod and quest officers and/or CommissionedCrews that results in officers being constantly unassigned from their ships after battle.
  - If you can consistently reproduce this I'd be interested to hear from you
- Probably so many bugs I _don't_ know about
```
Download: <https://github.com/atlanticaccent/officer-expansion/releases/download/0.0.4/price_of_command.zip>

items.name: Quality Captains
items.summary:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, competitive choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection. Every skill has been carefully tuned to maximize its potential by curating the good effects and adding the best from previous game versions. Most skills are more flexible than before, designed to benefit every ship and excel on specialized craft.
items.description:
**A gameplay-first, balance friendly, completely configurable skill overhaul.** 
QC brings QOL features, competitive choices, and more than 300 options to tweak the game to perfection. Every skill has been carefully tuned to maximize its potential by curating the good effects and adding the best from previous game versions. Most skills are more flexible than before, designed to benefit every ship and excel on specialized craft. 

Every skill is balanced against all the others and which you select will change your battles and your adventures.
 
Also makes ECM and Navigation battle effects way more fun.

Version 1.5 introduces a **perk system** with milestones that your character automatically unlocks as they progress through the story. These milestones include powerful QOL features and most of the effects are completely fresh to the modiverse. 

**Enjoy! Download is below ** or through the thread.
NB: To update from versions before 1.5, use uninstall mode, save, then update and toggle uninstall off. DM me if you run into trouble. 

Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21038.0

items.summary:
Adds some simple, totally optional settings of varying silliness to spice up your game.
``` ```
items.description:
Adds some simple, totally optional settings of varying silliness to spice up your game.
``` ```

# Current Features
- 🧾 Book of Grudges (negative rep with factions--and optionally players--lingers)
- 🔫 Autofit Tweaks (super minor, just reduces autofit randomness atm)
- 🏴‍☠️ Pirate Scholars (now they can learn things automatically! 🤓 )
- 📗 Blessed By Ludd (gives LP ships a chance to suppress Ill-Advised Mods)
- 👑 Make Sindria Great Again (gives LG and Diktat ships a chance to suppress Special Modifications)
- 📈 Doctrine Scaling (your favorite feature from last time, maybe, now better, maybe! if you're new here it means factions now scale, pog?)
- 📉 Commodity Scaling (silly, experimental way of reducing the amount of commodities you can purchase in markets. stop engaging in arbitrage and go kill things)
- 📵 No Free Storage (disables the free storage in the three abandoned stations in the Core Worlds. Ones outside the Core aren't affected, should they exist 👀)
- 🔐 Secure Markets (that other feature that at least one person liked, more or less the same! markets have defenses and stations and in some cases, annoying patrols!)

if you give me cool, easily implemented ideas, they probably won't get added to the mod! (but i promise i'll think about it)

- **Everything is togglable and editable in LunaLib**, which is pog.
   - you can turn everything off and have a mod that does nothing!!
- **Should be safe to add and remove at any point**, which is very pog.
   - but i didn't mark it utility so don't blame me for anything ty
- **If you download this mod, I will like you at least a little bit more than if you didn't**, and really, what could be more pog than that?
   - *terms and conditions apply*

items.name: Ship Browser 1.1
items.summary: Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.
items.description:
Do you have a chronic mod addiction that makes the list ships command produce several pages of console output? Do you like testing out ideas for fleets but hate flicking though the variant editor for 5 minutes straight adding smods?  I do, and I have spent hours automating parts of these minor inconveniences.

Some commands include:

**ShipBrowser**
Opens a gui ship browser that's organised by mod and ship class. The gui opens after the console is closed.

**CloneShip <shipNumber> [numberOfClones]**
Creates a copy of a specified ship in the player fleet. "shipNumber" is the order that ships appear in the refit screen. For example the fifth ship from the top in the refit sceen would be ship number 5. "numberOfClones" is a number that defaults to 1 if not specified.

**FindSystemsWithTags <manditory1stTag> [optionalAdditionalTags]**
List the star systems with all of the tags specified in the arguments. A list of tags can be found in com.fs.starfarer.api.impl.campaign.ids.Tags of the StarSector API. Input the string that corresponds to the tag obtained by viewing Constant Field Values. Can be used to find hypershunts and remnants

**AddDMods <shipSelection> <numDmods>**
Adds "numDmods" dmods to the ships specified by "shipSelection". "NumDmods" is a number. "shipSelection" can be a number (eg. 5), a range (eg, 5-10) or the word all. The numbers in "ShipSelection"  corresponds to the order ships appears in the fleet or refit screen. For example the fifth ship in the refit screen is ship 5.

A full list of commands can be found on the forum post. Note that some of the fleet editing commands don't work while the refit screen is open for some reason. No clue why

Download: https://github.com/itBeABruhmoment/ShipBrowser/releases/download/1.1/ShipBrowser1.1.zip
Forum: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=26261.msg390257#msg390257

items.name: Truly Automated Ships v1.2.5
items.summary: This mod changes the way AI cores on automated ships affect the rest of your fleet, making them more independent but also more expensive to maintain.
items.description:
This mod changes the way AI cores on automated ships affect the rest of your fleet, making them more independent but also more expensive to maintain.

In the vanilla game, AI officers increase the "automated ship points" of the ship they're attached to, and to me it doesn't make sense. If your automated fleet relies on the computing power of the rest of the fleet to coordinate itself - and that's why having too many automated ships leads to a decrease in maximum efficiency for all of them - then grabbing a tonne of GPUs and stitching them together with a ship should actually lift some of the weight from your regular ships, not add even more!

With this mod, when you slap a supercomputer on a hull, it will actually make the ship more autonomous, and decrease its "automated ship points," leaving you with the ability to increase the size of your automated fleet even more! But beware: all of this added computing power will require constant maintenance and a large energy supply. After all, you wouldn't expect a giant AI core with the capacity to manage entire planets to be easy to sustain, would you? The good news is that small ships will be reasonably cheap, but as hull size increases, so do maintenance costs.

v1.2.5 changelog
```
- Fixed bug with CR calculation
- Implemented compatibility with Tahlan Shipworks 1.2.1
```

Save compatibility notice
```
This mod is compatible with preexisting savefiles. However, after activating the mod you'll have to remove all AI cores already assigned to your ships and then reassign them, or CR calculation will be bugged for those ships.
If you have any ships with integrated cores, CR calculation will be bugged regardless. I'm working on fixing this.
```

Direct download: https://github.com/TobiaFi/TrulyAutomatedShips/releases/tag/v1.2.5
Forum Thread: https://fractalsoftworks.com/forum/index.php?topic=21547.0

Changelog:
PRIMARY: v1.0.1 - Balance patch. Lots of changes plus one addition. See the Git Repo release page for specifics. Summary of changes below.

  - Rebalanced the stats of the Metal Storm weapons to fix their broke OPness
  - Similar rebalance given to the Energy Storm weapons of the Vonlubu and Xuoffen fighters.
  - [NEW] Priate/Pather version of the MSDCA.
  - Restatted the BMSAC so its also balanced.
  - Buffed the range of the SRSMB and SRASMB.
  - The GKKRL now fires missiles individually instead of a fixed burst.
  - The Lichming-nahuo strategic drone bomber wing now costs 25 OP.
  - Some ships received some adjustments to their DP, FP, and supply/month to account for their apparent strengths.
  - Updated package imports for scripts that use MagicLib stuff.
  - Hopefully fixed an NPE related to the Seheryuan's hullmod scripts.
---

items.name: Yunru Industries
items.summary:
Changelog:
> - Removed ability to upgrade Bazaar to Commerce for increased compatibility
items.description:
Changelog:
> - Removed ability to upgrade Bazaar to Commerce for increased compatibility
> - Removed requirement to build a Bazaar to make a Commerce
> - Removed Tech-Mining change and made it it's own mod once more

Contents:
> Bazaar: Adds an open market to the colony, and a black market if free port is enabled.
> Auxiliary Shipbays: Increases the size of fleets produced by the colony, so you can enjoy more defenses with less FPS loss.
> Secondary Drydocks: Lets you dedicate a second industry slot to your Heavy Industry. Can also act as a backup Heavy Industry in a pinch.
> Advent Outreach: Train your security forces to take advantage of native knowledge. Note that on worlds with less than 100% hazard this would cause your forces to become lax and less effective.
